free.chess
Class Move

java.lang.Object
  free.chess.Move
Direct Known Subclasses:
ChessMove
public abstract class Move
extends java.lang.Object

This is the superclass of move implementations for various wild chess variants.

Field Summary
protected  Square endingSquare
          The square to which the moving piece moved.
protected  Player player
          The player making the move.
protected  Square startingSquare
          The square on which the moving piece was standing before the move.

Constructor Detail

Move

public Move(Square startingSquare,
            Square endingSquare,
            Player player,
            java.lang.String stringRepresentation)
Creates a new Move from the given starting Square to the given ending Square, with the given moving Player.

Both the starting and ending SQUARES may be null, as they sometimes are, for example in Kriegspiel.

The given stringRepresentation will be the string returned from the toString() method. It may be null, in which case a string constructed from the move data will be returned by toString().

Method Detail

getStartingSquare

public Square getStartingSquare()
Returns the initial square of the moving piece or null if unknown.

getEndingSquare

public Square getEndingSquare()
Returns the square to which the moving piece moved or null if unknown

getPlayer

public Player getPlayer()
Returns the Player making the move.

getStringRepresentation

public java.lang.String getStringRepresentation()
Returns the string representation of the move passed in the constructor. This may be null.

getMoveString

public java.lang.String getMoveString()
Returns a string representation of the move based on the move data.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns the string representation of this Move. If the value returned by getStringRepresentation() is not null, that is returned. Otherwise the value of getMoveString() is returned.

Overrides:
